intro: Biscutella laevigata proles secunda, commonly known as the smooth biscuitroot, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters, and its leaves are typically smooth and lance-shaped. It is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions. The species is noted for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
